title: Which good books are there about stochastic partial differential equations? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are quite a few of them actually. Here are some of the ones I like: An Introduction to Computational Stochastic PDEs by Powell, Lord, and ShardlowStochastic Partial Differential Equations: An Introduction by RocknerStochastic PDEs and Dynamics by Guo, Gao, and PuStochastic Partial Differential Equations by ChowStochastic PDEs and Modeling of Multiscale Complex Systems by Chen, Lv, and Wang

Not sure about books, as I haven’t come across many dealing with that specific topic. However, if you’re looking for a good introduction, I’d suggest looking at some of the epidemiology papers on SIRS models, particularly the ones using stochastic methods. That’s how I learned them, and there are many open-source papers out there that provide good introductions to the subject matter.
